thread.title: Forks gains confidence after win over Cards
thread.title_full: Forks gains confidence after win over Cards

title: Forks gains confidence after win over Cards
text:
Forks gains confidence after win over Cards 
By wbng sports October 12, 2015 Updated Oct 12, 2015 at 12:30 AM EDT 
Newark Valley, NY (WBNG Binghamton) It's the same old song and dance in Section IV: another Class C challenger stepped up against Chenango Forks and again Forks said, "wait your turn." 
The top-ranked Blue Devils (5-1) raced to a 27-0 lead on their way to a win at previously unbeaten No. 6 Newark Valley (5-1). The Cardinals have said from the start this year they wanted to take down Forks. 
WBNG E-News - Sign Up For Our Newsletter! 
In Week 6, they couldn't do it. 
While there's still a good chance Newark Valley could get another crack at Forks in the Class C sectional playoffs, the Blue Devils feel good knowing they have the horses to hold off the birds. 
"A lot of people are going to say we're likely, or there's a strong possibility of meeting them again. Maybe we will," said head coach Dave Hogan. "I think it speaks highly that we came in here and certainly had a great start." 
"It gives us some confidence because we know we might see them again later in the season," said senior Tony Silvanic, who stepped in at quarterback for an injured LJ Watson. 'We've just got to keep getting ready and not let up those big plays." 
Forks has already clinched its division in Class C with 2 weeks until the playoffs. The Blue Devils travel to Lansing in Week 7.
